elements.2211.03122_be4160a15ae19f289c41856a3313b: A computational anatomy atlas is a set of internal organ geometries
elements.2211.03122_0571e3b2c8037ff805d5451268026: It is based on data of real patients and complemented with virtual cases by using a some numerical approach
elements.2211.03122_8ebc70a1088593d87b51698b48132: Atlases are in demand in computational physiology, especially in cardiological and neurophysiological applications
elements.2211.03122_670d492ff58c6881aad518bbd0d2b: Usually, atlas generation uses explicit object representation, such as voxel models or surface meshes
elements.2211.03122_3876896b19923cdf66cbbe6baba83: In this paper, we propose a method of atlas generation using an implicit representation of 3D objects
elements.2211.03122_850c811d707fcaa5622eb55d284d6: Our approach has two key stages
elements.2211.03122_685dd8b92c2ffc334a3ea9757d3ff: The first stage converts voxel models of segmented organs to implicit form using the usual multilayer perceptron
elements.2211.03122_7fde53a160892ce889d6a7768da5b: This stage smooths the model and reduces memory consumption
elements.2211.03122_da62c58cf4c56f1b44831851797ac: The second stage uses a multilayer perceptron with Lipschitz regularization
elements.2211.03122_120b14bee224d53d76c692ea42b8f: This neural network provides a smooth transition between implicitly defined 3D geometries
elements.2211.03122_b251cc6beeabcf5b3fe7b380d6486: Our work shows examples of models of the left and right human ventricles
elements.2211.03122_a95b8e855a69f20767cc13cc2e3cb: All code and data for this work are open.
elements.2211.03122_84ceace3e1d6da7609ad9384b30ab: implicit representation, computational anatomy atlas, Lipschitz continuity, Lipschitz regularization, ML-engineering
elements.2211.03122_5e2226b804cdc1abf7d0f397325c5: A computational anatomy atlas is a collection of geometry models
elements.2211.03122_0f3bf14e813abbca6eceb5162f2b3: These models are organs or organ parts
elements.2211.03122_f1942aa9151f130ede5749486450f: The atlas is usually built on data of some patients and generates additional shapes using a numerical method
elements.2211.03122_e87484caf9d904325794e55899b0a: Most research is focused on cardiac atlases
elements.2211.03122_e39961d5e1e27ef22aef83d854e81: In computational cardiology, the atlases extend the number of simulation cases
elements.2211.03122_90381b7bde41b93f1da5b568f73fc: In the neurological sciences, atlases usually help with measurements of variability for complex 3D structures
elements.2211.03122_e85909cbff78d6680c5275f3155fe: The atlases also can produce shapes of personalized implants for surgery replacements of the vertebrae and joints
elements.2211.03122_d6c572635e867618863232cd84f15: The most general approach to the computational atlas is a diffeomorphism that map some vector
elements.2211.03122_8339e70f6b318bcccea6c2bbfc771: is a simplified representation of objects
elements.2211.03122_1a76c969ca439823d2cd067fba8d4: becomes an analog of principal components and
elements.2211.03122_b108a1c03d867a29641268d3bca55: allows a researcher to measure the distance between shapes and generate new shapes using some operations with
elements.2211.03122_2858f5c9908a3419aa240df440a23: instead of working with original geometries
elements.2211.03122_34a0a7724e5c8db177e7a9ed6bd92: Another approach is to reduce of the atlas generation problem to the shape interpolation problem
elements.2211.03122_f5b335c3f189bde20bf5b3a428748: The last one is being studied in computer graphic applications
elements.2211.03122_0b8904e9784e73663a4458363369b: Usually, 3D objects are presented as voxel models, point clouds, or surface meshes
elements.2211.03122_3860221791d6bd7fe879b7a7b7f13: These approaches are known as explicit representation
elements.2211.03122_7101c4bc99f340f409fa9b9ade1a2: Implicit representation presents an object in form of function
elements.2211.03122_9a99b18952a65946a0b5df6fa6ddc: The object's surface is an isosurface of zero level
elements.2211.03122_d8fb7882210f256c62620e65fcb07: This definition is more useful when
elements.2211.03122_516fc20b356aade17468f0564dd06: is a signed distance function (SDF) of the object
elements.2211.03122_2d1bb7400b7e57a41ef4c54351696: shows a distance to the object.
elements.2211.03122_129c51887ed3c21d1abda8e539248: is located outside the object, and
elements.2211.03122_6d7355e4a99826dc3946cee5a64b0: SDF may be approximated with its value on a uniform grid
elements.2211.03122_6095b0ffd29b286b86d7fc9e140bf: This is known as a signed distance field
elements.2211.03122_c731caa62400d529a04e04ff0a55e: To avoid ambiguous notation for function and field, we denote a 3D array of distances to the object surface as a signed distance tensor (SDT) instead of the signed distance field
elements.2211.03122_4b6066feaf06eed39cef8c9d25e8c: The other approach, is to approximate of SDF with some method of function approximation, for example with multilayer perceptron (MLP)
elements.2211.03122_e6a150e6a923817c0e31d0e766cf6: Recent advances in implicit representation of 3D objects is a multilayer perceptron with Lipschitz regularization (LipMLP)
elements.2211.03122_7f648f253d37e4e677401b7532394: This approach uses a special loss to force MLP to satisfy the Lipschitz condition:
elements.2211.03122_a8d7ec6c422cf3ca37e92531af2c7: If this neural network is trained to the implicit representation of 3D objects, then it can produce a smooth transition between objects on inference
elements.2211.03122_21c4280f12d454cc0c11aff739300: In this paper, we propose an approach to building a computational anatomy atlas
elements.2211.03122_389c084dca24e32edd55224408550: Here the atlas generation problem is reduced to the shape interpolation problem
elements.2211.03122_802e74e6e9dc8de880ec2d95af5c7: The first stage of this work converts the voxel model to a discrete signed distance field and then converts this tensor to a signed distance function (SDF) using the usual MLP
elements.2211.03122_262ff3e68e3b6c18474e14470b646: The second stage trains the MLP with Lipschitz regularization (LipMLP) to provide a smooth transition between SDFs.

elements.2211.03122_7e80843c3897faa7ca93b940cab8a: In this work, we propose a new approach to building the computational anatomy atlas
elements.2211.03122_514dedd0e9c0e1fbff57ce423c039: Our approach employs an implicit neural representation of 3D objects from
elements.2211.03122_0cd9764ad8201cf919b74a37e6fe3: The first step is to convert the original voxel model to SDF
elements.2211.03122_74cb724d6a391f2219037d1f2505c: The conversion provides smoothing for the rough voxel model and reduces memory consumption for further operations
elements.2211.03122_5e0da39ae1aa558a64b99135f9bb8: The second step is to train LipMLP on the set of objects and to infer LipMLP with parameters that mix the original geometries in some proportions
elements.2211.03122_1f8ee3c5c5ba581eb6656a93d3718: Thus, the problem of building an anatomical atlas is reduced to the problem of shape interpolation, which is solved with neural networks.
elements.2211.03122_06dd6c362767f44a9597719ac32e7: Examples are available as part of the Neural Network for Digital Twin (NNDT) package:
elements.2211.03122_cef52b90e5577a78b330e4fae5a7f: NNDT is our experimental open source library that implements some methods for computational anatomy and physiology with the neural network
elements.2211.03122_e5c4bc737ce8d2605fb9c6ca6be47: Note that we are working on the library and some APIs will be changed in further releases.
